alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 9:07PM EST until December 18 at 11:30PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Deerfield At Charlemont affecting Franklin and Berkshire Counties. ...Observed flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Massachusetts... West Deerfield River AT West Deerfield affecting Franklin County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...West Deerfield River at West Deerfield. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, The Deerfield River oversrpeads some of the lowest lying farmland in the Deerfield area. Floodwaters inundate a portion of Pogues Hole Road. Also lowest lying recreational fields and parking lots nearby the river start to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 25.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM EST Monday was 11.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 4.6 feet early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.4 feet on 12/17/2000. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1130 PM EST.
